description.narrative: The Project Development Objective is to improve access in the delivery of selected public services in Assam.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Completion Report | Description :Assam to provide to the Borrower for incorporation in the report referred to inSection 5.08 (c) of the General Conditions all such information as the Borrower or the Bank shall reasonably request. | Due Date:30-Nov-2022

Finance Agreement :DLI Verification (1/2) | Description :Assam to undertake a verification process in accordance with the DLIVerification Protocol and in a manner satisfactory to the Borrower and the Bank, through the independent third party entity orentities to ascertain whether the DLI Targets have been achieved for the respective DLI Period(s) under review. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :DLI Verification (2/2) | Description :Assam to furnish to the Borrower and the Bank corresponding verificationreports, in form and substance acceptable to the Bank. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Financial Management (1/3) | Description :Borrower and Assam to have their Financial Statements audited inaccordance with the provisions of Section 5.09 (b) of the General Conditions. Each audit of the Financial Statements shall coverthe period of one fiscal year of the Borrower, commencing with the fiscal year in which the first withdrawal was made under thePreparation Advance for the Project. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Financial Management (2/3) | Description :The audited Financial Statements for each such period shall befurnished to the Bank. in respect of Part 1 of the Project | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Financial Management (3/3) | Description :The audited Financial Statements for each such period shall befurnished to the Bank in respect of Part 2 of the Project. | Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :Financial Management Manual | Description :Assam to implement the Project in accordance with the FinancialManagement Manual. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Operations Manual | Description :Assam to adopt the Operations Manual in a form and substance satisfactory tothe Bank and implement the Project in accordance with the Operations Manual. | Due Date :18-Aug-2017

Finance Agreement :Project Guidance Council and Governing Body | Description :Assam to maintain, within ARIAS: (a) the ProjectGuidance Council, with mandate and composition satisfactory to the Bank, and responsible for the overall management of the Project;and (b) the Governing Body, with mandate and composition satisfactory to the Bank. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Project Management Unit | Description :Assam to maintain, throughout the period of implementation of theProject, the Project Management Unit within ARIAS Society, headed by a Project director, with functions and resources satisfactoryto the Bank and with staff in adequate numbers and with qualifications, experience and terms of reference satisfactory to the Bank.| Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Safeguards | Description :Borrower and Assam to: (a) carry out the Project in accordance with the EnvironmentalManagement Plan and the Tribal Development Plan in a manner and substance satisfactory to the Bank; and (b) refrain from taking anyaction, or consenting to an action to be taken, which would prevent or interfere with the implementation of the EnvironmentalManagement Plans and/or the Tribal Development Plan. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

title.narrative: Improved processes for targeted services in Government departments

target.value: Process improvement done for 23 services during the year.Cumulatively process improvement implemented for 104 services.

actual.value: BPR of RTPS services with recommendations for administrative process refinements and technical changes have been completed for 87services. The departments/ autonomous councils are in the process of issuing notifications/ OMs to operationalize the BPR for theremaining 17 services.

title.narrative: Access to RTPS Services expanded to Targeted districts

target.value: Notification of 10 new RTPS services by at least two Autonomous Councils (i.e. total 90 new services notified in the targeteddistricts).

actual.value: The three Autonomous Councils, Bodoland Territorial Council, Karbi Anglong Autonomous Council (KAAC) and N C Hills AutonomousCouncil (NCHAC), have so far notified 110 services under the RTPS – surpassing the end target of 90 for this indicator

title.narrative: Operational Facilitation Centers comprising PFCs and Common Service Centers (CSCs) to serve as points of access for RTPS Services

baseline.value: 30 fully operational Public Facilitation Centers identified.

target.value: (i) Additional 75 new PFCs operational over Year 4 (i.e. total 280 centers);(ii) Additional 500 CSCs accredited to deliver RTPSservices (total 1500)

actual.value: A total of 325 PFC has been made operational and are delivering services meeting end target.CSC MoU has been signed in July 2021 -integration process underway to accredit CSCs to deliver RTPS services.

title.narrative: Number of applications submitted on-line for RTPS services.

actual.value: The end target of this indicator has been met by the project.The efforts are now being directed to integrate all electronicallydelivered RTPS services with the ARTPS Portal to serve as the single gateway for service access; and for unified tracking ofcompliance relating to service delivery timeline. Also more services are getting listed on the portal.

title.narrative: Number of Services notified under RTPS Act

baseline.value: 55 RTPS services have been notified. under the Act.

target.value: 40 additional RTPS Services over Year 4 notified.Cumulatively 185 RTPS Services notified.

actual.value: Total of 310 services have been notified under the RTPS Act - surpassing the end target of 185 services for the project.

title.narrative: Number of applications for RTPS with women as beneficiaries

baseline.value: Applications for RTPS with women as beneficiaries at 20%.

actual.value: As per the RTPS Dashboard report on November 26, 2021, from a total of 48,226 (1074 NA, not included in the count) number ofapplications, 13,881 number are women - i.e. 28.78% are women beneficiaries.

baseline.value: Detailed project report and implementation plan to be approved by GoA.

actual.value: The RTPS portal was launched with 47 services on October 7, 2021. Another 7 services were added during November 2021, taking thecount of available online services to 54 as on November 30, 2021. Online tracking of RTPS services can be monitored. Online RTPSServices are being rendered and an MIS of the RTPS Portal delivered services is available. A more integrated MIS platform is underdevelopment.

title.narrative: Compliant ARTPS applications related to 10 most availed services delivered within timeframe prescribed by ARTPS Act

baseline.value: For 10 most availed services, 35% compliant ARTPS applications delivered within timeframe prescribed by ARTPS Act

target.value: 25% increase over Baseline in compliance with notified service delivery timelines in 10 most availed RTPS services.Cumulatively60% compliance with notified service delivery timelines in 10 most availed RTPS services

actual.value: Data based on portal only applications show about 79% completion. But this is not comprehensive as all RTPS service delivery is notyet fully integrated with the portal. Comprehensive tracking of this Indicator would be done after the launch of the centralisedRTPS MIS portal when more reliable estimates would be determined..

title.narrative: Increase in RTPS beneficiary feedback on service delivery

target.value: Citizens' Feedback on RTPS delivery collected, analyzed and published

actual.value: Beneficiary feedback mechanism operationalized through Call CenterAs on November 23, 2021, a total of 6,579 beneficiaries havebeen reached, of whom 4,929 provided feedback: 65% respondents expressed that overall experience of availing service under RTPS Actis very satisfactory; 61% respondents shared that the experience of receiving the applied service in the RTPS Portal has beenbefore time with excellent quality.

title.narrative: ARTPS Policy framework and institutional mechanism strengthened

baseline.value: ARTPS Act 2012 enacted and ARTPS Rules 2012 framed

actual.value: An Appellate Authority has been notified for each RTPS notified Service.Notifications to allow Assam Administrative Tribunal (AAT)to act as the ARTPS Commission has been issued.Notifications on the operational modalities of ARTPS Commission has been issued.Appeal Management System is operational on the ARTPS portal.ARTPS Penal provisions have been notified in RTPS Act and the Rulesof Business of the ARTPS Commission .Grievances Redressal Mechanism is operational on the ARTPS Portal.

title.narrative: Number of Online Services available at the ARTPS Portal

target.value: Additional 49 services made available during the year. Cumulatively 95 services made available on RTPS portal.

actual.value: Subsequent to the launch of the RTPS portal (with 47 services), another 7 services have been added. The total number of services ason November 30, 2021 stands at 54.
